intro: Silene buglossifolia, commonly known as the plains silene, is a flowering plant native to the central and western United States. It is a member of the Caryophyllaceae family and typically grows in open, dry habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and often have a bluish-green hue, and it is characterized by its ability to thrive in arid conditions. Silene buglossifolia plays a role in stabilizing soil and providing nectar for pollinators in its native range.
